page.title: 12DALEFORD QUARRY,WHITEGATE
page.content: The extraction of the sand it expected to finish in 30 to 40 years' time. The land will be turned into agricultural land, the quality of which will greatly improved because the sand has been removed. The quarry will be filled in when the extraction has finished: this will take 3 months. Many birds, including sandmartins, nest around the quarry because the trees are not disturbed. The workers are careful to extract the sand from in between the trees. There is a large element of risk, both financially and physically. Large fences have been put up to keep out trespassers, who might ruin the equip- ment or might be hurt on the machines. The financial dangers are that planning permission might be refused after the land has been bought.
